text: is a Japanese football player. She plays for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Ueki was born in Kawasaki on July 30, 1999. She joined Nadeshiko League club Nippon TV Beleza (later Nippon TV Tokyo Verdy Beleza) from their youth team in 2016. She became a regular player as forward from 2017 season. In 2016, Ueki was selected the Japan U-17 national team for 2016 U-17 World Cup. She played at 5 matches and scored 4 goals, and Japan won the 2nd place. In 2018, Ueki was selected the Japan U-20 national team for 2018 U-20 World Cup. She played at all 6 matches and scored 5 goals, and Japan won the championship. On April 4, 2019, Ueki debuted for Japan national team against France. ==Statistics== List of match in 2019, 2020 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2019 3 0 2020 2 0 Total 5 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Association Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Kanagawa Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nippon TV Tokyo Verdy Beleza players
title: Riko Ueki
